31 weeks*
Your midwife or doctor should give you 
information about preparing for labour and birth, 
including how to recognise active labour, ways of 
coping with pain in labour and your birth plan. Your 
midwife or doctor should:
• review, discuss and record the results of any 
screening tests from the last appointment;
• use a tape or undertake an ultrasound scan
